verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329>, A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>. O LORD <WH3068>, thou hast searched <WH2713> me, and known <WH3045> me.
Thou knowest <WH3045> my downsitting <WH3427> and mine uprising <WH6965>, thou understandest <WH995> my thought <WH7454> afar off <WH7350>.
Thou compassest <WH2219> my path <WH734> and my lying down <WH7252>, and art acquainted <WH5532> with all my ways <WH1870>.
For there is not a word <WH4405> in my tongue <WH3956>, but, lo, O LORD <WH3068>, thou knowest <WH3045> it altogether.
Thou hast beset <WH6696> me behind <WH268> and before <WH6924>, and laid <WH7896> thine hand <WH3709> upon me.
Such knowledge <WH1847> is too wonderful <WH6383> <WH6383> for me; it is high <WH7682>, I cannot <WH3201> attain unto it.
Whither shall I go <WH3212> from thy spirit <WH7307>? or whither shall I flee <WH1272> from thy presence <WH6440>?
If I ascend up <WH5266> into heaven <WH8064>, thou art there: if I make my bed <WH3331> in hell <WH7585>, behold, thou art there.
If I take <WH5375> the wings <WH3671> of the morning <WH7837>, and dwell <WH7931> in the uttermost parts <WH319> of the sea <WH3220>;
Even there shall thy hand <WH3027> lead <WH5148> me, and thy right hand <WH3225> shall hold <WH270> me.
If I say <WH559>, Surely the darkness <WH2822> shall cover <WH7779> me; even the night <WH3915> shall be light <WH216> about me <WH1157>.
Yea, the darkness <WH2822> hideth <WH2821> not from thee; but the night <WH3915> shineth <WH215> as the day <WH3117>: the darkness <WH2825> and the light <WH219> are both alike to thee.
For thou hast possessed <WH7069> my reins <WH3629>: thou hast covered <WH5526> me in my mother's <WH517> womb <WH990>.
I will praise <WH3034> thee; for I am fearfully <WH3372> and wonderfully made <WH6395>: marvellous <WH6381> are thy works <WH4639>; and that my soul <WH5315> knoweth <WH3045> right well <WH3966>.
My substance <WH6108> was not hid <WH3582> from thee, when I was made <WH6213> in secret <WH5643>, and curiously wrought <WH7551> in the lowest parts <WH8482> of the earth <WH776>.

Thine eyes <WH5869> did see <WH7200> my substance, yet being unperfect <WH1564>; and in thy book <WH5612> all my members were written <WH3789>, which in continuance <WH3117> were fashioned <WH3335>, when as yet there was none <WH259> of them.
How precious <WH3365> also are thy thoughts <WH7454> unto me, O God <WH410>! how great <WH6105> is the sum <WH7218> of them!
If I should count <WH5608> them, they are more in number <WH7235> than the sand <WH2344>: when I awake <WH6974>, I am still <WH5750> with thee.
Surely thou wilt slay <WH6991> the wicked <WH7563>, O God <WH433>: depart <WH5493> from me therefore, ye bloody <WH1818> men <WH582>.
For they speak <WH559> against thee wickedly <WH4209>, and thine enemies <WH6145> take <WH5375> thy name in vain <WH7723>.
Do not I hate <WH8130> them, O LORD <WH3068>, that hate <WH8130> thee? and am not I grieved <WH6962> with those that rise up <WH8618> against thee?
I hate <WH8130> them with perfect <WH8503> hatred <WH8135>: I count them mine enemies <WH341>.
Search <WH2713> me, O God <WH410>, and know <WH3045> my heart <WH3824>: try <WH974> me, and know <WH3045> my thoughts <WH8312>:
And see <WH7200> if there be any wicked <WH6090> way <WH1870> in me, and lead <WH5148> me in the way <WH1870> everlasting <WH5769>.
